s0252: The proverb says: "When a beautiful woman enters the household, she becomes the enemy of ugly women."
s0254: Master Chu says: Bathing need not be in the Jiang or Hai rivers, the important thing is to remove filth;
s0255: Horses need not be Qiji steeds, the important thing is that they run well;
s0256: Scholars need not be worthy of their age, the important thing is that they know the Way;
s0257: Women need not be of noble birth, the important thing is that they are chaste and good.
s0258: The tradition says: "Women, regardless of beauty or ugliness, when they enter the household are envied;
s0259: Scholars, regardless of worthiness or unworthiness, when they enter court are resented."
s0260: Beautiful women are the enemies of ugly women.
s0262: Lady Gouyi was surnamed Zhao, from Hejian.
s0263: She received Emperor Wu's favor and bore one son, who was Emperor Zhao.
s0264: Emperor Wu was seventy years old when he fathered Emperor Zhao.
s0265: When Emperor Zhao ascended, he was only five years old.
s0266: After the Wei crown prince was deposed, no crown prince was re-established.
s0267: King Yan Dan submitted a memorial, wishing to return to his state and enter the palace guard.
s0268: Emperor Wu was angry and immediately executed his envoy at the Northern Gate.
s0269: The emperor resided in Ganquan Palace and summoned painters to depict the Duke of Zhou carrying King Cheng.
s0270: Therefore the ministers on his left and right knew Emperor Wu intended to establish his younger son.
s0271: Several days later, the emperor reproached Lady Gouyi.
s0272: The lady removed her hairpins and earrings and knocked her head.
s0273: The emperor said: "Lead her away and send her to the Rear Court Prison!"
s0274: The lady looked back, and the emperor said: "Hurry and go, you will not live!"
s0275: The lady died in Yunyang Palace.
s0276: At the time violent winds raised dust, and the people were sorrowful.
s0277: Envoys carried the coffin at night to bury her, sealing and marking the place.
s0278: Afterward, when the emperor was at leisure, he asked those on his left and right: "What do people say?"
s0279: Those on his left and right replied: "People say he will establish his son, so why did he kill his mother?"
s0281: These are matters that you children and foolish people do not understand.
s0282: In ancient times states became disordered because the ruler was young and the mother was strong.
s0283: Female rulers living alone become arrogant and stubborn, indulging in licentious disorder, with none able to restrain them.
s0284: Have you not heard of Empress Lü?"
s0285: Therefore, all who bore sons for Emperor Wu, regardless of male or female children, their mothers without exception were reproached to death—can this be said not to be worthy and sage-like!
s0286: Clearly seeing far ahead, planning for future generations, this is indeed beyond what shallow scholars and foolish Confucians can attain.
s0287: His posthumous title was "Wu"—how could it be in vain!
